definition: to digress/to get sidetracked/to go off on a tangent
to pull/to tear/(of cloth, thread etc) to buy/to chat/to gossip/(coll.) (Tw) ridiculous/hokey
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: Withdrawn far, mocking me with mock-congratulatory signs and bows.
sentences.chinese: 扯遠些，讓嘲弄的道賀躬影嘲笑也不着急。

sentences.english: At least one member of the audience, a gray-haired man, seemed to think that this was going a bit too far.
sentences.chinese: 最後一個灰頭髮的男人認爲這個話題扯遠了。

sentences.english: You take our topic too far.
